tables_on_page.title: Magnetizing Current Interrupting Capability
tables_on_page.summary: Table of magnetizing current interrupting capability: Magnetizing Current Interrupting Capability

text:
Catalog Section 1400
 Bulletin No. 1400-A April, 1995
Supersedes Bulletin No. 1400 dated August, 1963
 SWITCH
ACCESSORIES
 Either included as components of group operated
switches at the time of purchase, or purchased
separately, Southern States accessory equipment is
engineered and manufactured to the same exacting
standards we apply to all our other products.
 Quick Break Arcing Horns
Auxiliary Switches
Mechanical Interlocks
Electrical Interlocks
Worm Gear Operators
Spill Gaps
 Outriggers
 Position Indicators
 Pipe Insulation
Threaded Pipe Clevises
 Grounding Switches
Grounding Devices
Mounting Structures
 Quick Break Arcing Horns through 161 kV
for interrupting transformer magnetizing and line
charging currents can be applied on vertical
break, center break and double side break
switches in both standard and Vee mountings.
 Voltage - KV
 *Based on 1% excitation current.
 Line Charging Current Interrupting Capability
 Voltage - KV
 HIGH VOLTAGE
SWITCHMAKERS
 SS
 Southern States, Inc.

image_captions_on_page.generated_caption:
**Type of image:** Catalog Page

**Main components:** Photographs of Quick Break Arcing Horns, tables of Magnetizing Current Interrupting Capability and Line Charging Current Interrupting Capability, and a list of Switch Accessories.

**Technical details:**
*   Catalog Section 1400, Bulletin No. 1400-A, April 1995
*   Switch Accessories: Quick Break Arcing Horns, Auxiliary Switches, Mechanical Interlocks, Electrical Interlocks, Worm Gear Operators, Spill Gaps, Outriggers, Position Indicators, Pipe Insulation, Threaded Pipe Clevises, Grounding Switches, Grounding Devices, Mounting Structures
*   Magnetizing Current Interrupting Capability (Vertical Break): Voltage (kV) 7.5-46, 69, 115, 138, 161; Transformer (MVA) 35, 70, 120, 140, 160
*   Line Charging Current Interrupting Capability (Vertical Break): Voltage (kV) 7.5-69, 115, 138, 161; Amperes 15, 12, 8, 6
*   Southern States, Inc.
*   High Voltage Switchmakers
*   Quick Break Arcing Horns through 161 kV
*   Based on 1% excitation current

**Technical details:**
*   Catalog Section 1400, Bulletin No. 1400-A, April 1995
*   Switch Accessories: Quick Break Arcing Horns, Auxiliary Switches, Mechanical Interlocks, Electrical Interlocks, Worm Gear Operators, Spill Gaps, Outriggers, Position Indicators, Pipe Insulation, Threaded Pipe Clevises, Grounding Switches, Grounding Devices, Mounting Structures
*   Magnetizing Current Interrupting Capability (Vertical Break): Voltage (kV) 7.5-46, 69, 115, 138, 161; Transformer (MVA) 35, 70, 120, 140, 160

SS
 Southern
States, Inc.
 SWITCH
ACCESSORIES
 The Type AVS-1 and AV-1 auxiliary switches
can be employed for many purposes, but are
used principally for remote indication of line
and/or grounding switch positions and to control
electrical interlocks. They feature simple, linear
circuitry, and easy adjustment. For adjustment,
the entire housing is removed, providing
excellent access. Available in sizes from two
poles up to eighteen, linkage or gear driven.
 FIGURE 3
 ད༠)) “ ེབ•བ
 FIGURE 2
 (Right) Sixteen pole auxiliary switch, less cover, wiring and
drive mechanism. Logical, straight-through circuitry and
accessible cam lobes make adjustment easy and precise.
 FIGURE 4
 Vertical Pipe Insulation: If required, the
vertical operating pipe can be supplied with
porcelain or wood inserts. Wood inserts are
treated to industry specifications and are 3.75"
square, 8' standard length.
 Wood Interphase Rods are also available
with square sections of either 2" or 3.75".
 The heavy duty Mechanical Interlock is an
easily installed safety device that prevents a line
switch and its grounding switch from being
closed at the same time. It uses a simple cam
mechanism that is completely shielded from ice
formation to ensure smooth, safe, automatic
operation regardless of environmental conditions.
An important feature is easy installation after the
vertical operating pipe is in place, facilitating later
equipment upgrades.
 Electrical and Key Interlocks are also
available (Refer to the factory).
 FIGURE 5

Headings: SS | SWITCH
ACCESSORIES | FIGURE 3 | ད༠)) “ ེབ•བ | FIGURE 2 | FIGURE 4 | FIGURE 5

AI caption: **Type of image:** Diagram

**Main components:** Auxiliary switches, mechanical interlocks, and insulation components for electrical systems.

**Technical details:**
*   Switch Accessories, Page 2
*   Type AVS-1 and AV-1 auxiliary switches
*   Sixteen pole auxiliary switch
*   Vertical Pipe Insulation: porcelain or wood inserts, 3.75" square, 8' standard length
*   Wood Interphase Rods: 2" or 3.75" square sections
*   Mechanical Interlock
*   Electrical and Key Interlocks
*   Figures 2, 3, 4, 5

FIGURE 6
 SWITCH
ACCESSORIES
 Southern
States, Inc.
 Tubing material
 copper or aluminum
 depending on conductor specified
ОО
 O
 Threaded Pipe Clevises are optional in lieu of
the standard U-bolted clevises to facilitate
incremental switch adjustment. Cast nodular
iron, galvanized.
 FIGURE 7
 Outriggers control the position of cable
conductors to overcome clearance problems.
These cast aluminum components are bolted
between the insulators and the switch live parts.
Standard lengths are 2'-6" through 6'-0".
 A light duty type is also available that mounts
directly to the switch terminal pad.
 FIGURE 8
 FIGURE 9
 Cast aluminum Switch Position Indicators are
red (closed) and green (open), and are mounted
to the vertical operating pipe with hose clamps.
Also available with a window type housing.
 Standard on switches of higher ratings, the Type
HOGO Worm Gear Manual Operator can be
specified in lieu of swing handles for lower
ratings if desired, or retrofitted to existing
equipment. Smooth, easy operating and
lightweight, it is quickly installed and can be
padlocked with the switch either open or closed.
(30:1 gear ratio; available with handles up to
18".)
 Grounding Switches: A complete
line of grounding switches is
available in copper and aluminum
through 230 kV, and in aluminum
through 765 kV; momentary ratings
up to 120 kA.
 High Speed Grounding
Switches are described in detail in
catalog bulletins 401, 402 and 403.
 FIGURE 10
 บาบา
 Spill Gaps protect against lightning surges, or
adjust flashover to ground. The Adjustable
Rod Type Spill Gaps are mounted to the
switch base and under the switch live parts, and
are quickly and easily adjustable to precise
dimensions.

Section: 00
ОО
Headings: FIGURE 6 | SWITCH
ACCESSORIES | 00
ОО | O | FIGURE 7 | FIGURE 8 | FIGURE 9 | FIGURE 10 | บาบา

AI caption: **Type of image:** Technical Diagram

**Main components:** Depicts various switch accessories including threaded pipe clevises, outriggers, switch position indicators, worm gear manual operator, grounding switches, and spill gaps.

**Technical details:**
*   Figure 6: Threaded Pipe Clevises, U-bolted clevises, cast nodular iron, galvanized.
*   Figure 7: Outriggers, cast aluminum, standard lengths 2'-6" through 6'-0". Tubing material: copper or aluminum.
*   Figure 9: Cast aluminum Switch Position Indicators, red (closed), green (open).
*   HOGO Worm Gear Manual Operator: 30:1 gear ratio, handles up to 18".
*   Grounding Switches: up to 230 kV (copper and aluminum), up to 765 kV (aluminum), up to 120 kA. Catalog bulletins 401, 402, 403.
*   Adjustable Rod Type Spill Gaps.
*   Southern States, Inc. Switch Accessories. Page 3.

 Other accessories available include
Grounding Studs, Braidless and Multi-
revolution Grounding Devices, and
Electrical and Mechanical Interlock
Adapters.
 In addition, Southern States can supply
customized equipment mounting frames in
both aluminum and steel. Please contact
the factory for details.

AI caption: **Type of image:** Engineering diagrams

**Main components:** Steel crossarms and frames for switches, including standard steel crossarms, standard steel frames, standard one pole steel frames, and standard two pole steel frames.

**Technical details:**
*   **Text:** Southern States, Inc., Switch Accessories, Page 4, Standard Steel Crossarms and Frames: For switches through 69 kV and 1200 Amp. Conductor pull load maximum 1000 lb. per conductor. Easy mounting.
*   **Figures:** Figure 11, Figure 12, Figure 13, Figure 14
*   **Labels:** Standard Steel Crossarm, Standard Steel Frame, Standard One Pole Steel Frame, Standard Two Pole Steel Frame
*   **Tables:**
    *   Equip. Voltage Rating, Catalog Number, Net Wt., A, B, C (for Figure 11, 12, 13, 14)
    *   Voltage ratings: 7.2, 14.4, 23, 34.5, 46, 69 kV
    *   Catalog Numbers: 3460-1, 3460-2, 3460-4, 3460-5, 3460-8, 3460-9, 3460-11, 3460-12, 3460-13, 3460-15, 3460-16, 3460-17
*   **Measurements:** Dimensions labeled as A, B, C, D in inches.
